Posts.Content: Bobcat86 wrote: We really need to get the real statistics out to the public that 7 % are initially diagnosed with stage IV Breast cancer and over 30% of the supposively cured early stages 0-3 well develop stage IV that is the awareness that needs to be brought to the public view.   Look on the Stage  IV forum and see for yourself almost all were diagnosed with early stage breast cancer 2yrs, 5yrs,8yrs1 15yrs... after the original diagnoses.   We have to join as one force!!i Every  stage of Breast cancer has to stand up together and demand a true cure.   We want transparency these organizations have to give more money  to the cause not administrative costs!  If we join together as one  we are stronger and our numbers are astronomical   (stage 0-IV) they will have to listen!   We must DEMAND A CURE!!!! How many more lives do we have to lose, How many mothers, fathers, sisters, cousins, daughters, sons, friends, neighbors  and coworkers do we have to watch die!!!  Our voices have to be heard!!! No more pink we all should show up at the pink rallies wearing black to honor all the lives that have been lost and show everyone that this is what cancer truly is not pretty and pink get our message out there let them know we demand a cure!   United we can win a true cure for breast cancer!  Let's join forces and fight breast cancer toget Dx 5/2015, Right, Stage IV, ER+/PR+, HER2- (FISH) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: We must stand united all stages of breast cancer for cure Bobcat86 Bobcat86

Posts.Content: Bobcat86 wrote: Need help from my NYC community! My oncologist is leaving Sloan for research and I need a new oncologist, these will be tough shoes to fill. Please help! Dx 5/2015, Right, Stage IV, ER+/PR+, HER2- (FISH) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Stage 4 need name of a great oncologist NYC Bobcat86 blainejennifer

Posts.Content: Bobcat86 wrote: I believe that we all have to unite as one and demand a cure for breast cancer!  Here is the awareness that they are not putting out there enough, over 30% of early stage breast cancer                  Stages  0- 3 will  metastasize all different subtypes and there is NO cure. They will die from breast cancer!   Who will become  one of the over 30% that will develop metastatic cancer no on knows! And initially  6-7% start of as metastatic cancer right from the start  so that is close to 37% will succumb to breast cancer. Over 44,000 lives are lost every year just in the USA.  We need more transparency of where the money we raise is going.   We want to know what percentage goes for administration cost?What are these administrative cost? What are the salaries of the CEO's of these organizations?    It is time to unite and take a stand and demand a true cure. How many more mothers, daughters, friends, fathers, sons, coworkers... Do we have to watch die!   We are not disposable.  If we stand together are numbers are to great to ignore we have to make a statement and let the world know we want to live and we want more money to go directly for a true cure! After all of the money that is collected and is divided up after all the administrative costs... How is the money that is to go to the caused divided up.   I know that actually  only 2% of that money goes to metastatic breast cancer . Remember over 30% of breast cancer will become metastatic cancer and  Metastatic breast cancer will take your life. I am not trying to frighten anyone I am trying to make you aware.  This is truly the facts this is awareness .  I think we should all throw out the pink. Cancer is not pink and pretty they have commercialized breast cancer.   We should wear all black all day in honor of all the mothers, daughter's, grandmothers, sisters, fathers, sons, aunts, uncles, friends, neighbors and coworkers who have lost there lives while we wait for a cure  wear black to all day on October 13th in support of metastatic breast cancer.  Wear black to the pink rallies let's turn the pink to black to bring awareness .  The organizations want it to be a happy day a pink day but truly is it ? Now that we know the facts and that over 30% of the people at the rallies will develop stage IV metastatic cancer. We must use our large numbers to bring awareness to a true cure. So someday hopefully in the near future no one will die from breast cancer Dx 5/2015, Right, Stage IV, ER+/PR+, HER2- (FISH) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Stage 0 - IV unite for a true cure Bobcat86 Bobcat86

Posts.Content: Jun 30, 2015 04:39PM Bobcat86 wrote: Thank you so much for for all the information . It is a tough decision and I do understand all that goes along with the surgery . Everything is all so new and scary. I look around at the oncology center I go to and all I see is women and a handful of men and I just wonder what is happening! The number of women with breast cancer just keep going up and no real answers it's frightening
Posts.Title: masectomy for stage iv breast cancer Bobcat86 Zillsnot4me

Posts.Content: Jun 30, 2015 04:44PM Bobcat86 wrote: Thank you I am just trying to sort this all out! I I feel that I am not being given options. It seems no one in ny will do a masectomy on stage IV
Posts.Title: masectomy for stage iv breast cancer Bobcat86 Zillsnot4me

Posts.Content: Bobcat86 wrote: I was just diagnosised with stage iv breast cancer last month, May 2015.  I had found a lump about two months prior had a diagnostic mammogram, ultrasound and a core biopsy.  They had thought it was a stage two.  I had a date for a double  masectomy but I had been complain of headaches for 6 months so I asked if I could get a cat scan or MRI of my head.  Well I had a full body pet scan and we found a hot spot on the hip nothing anywhere else. Then I had bone biopsy which then changed the diagnosis to stage iv breast cancer and now the masectomy is not an option I was told by a major cancer hospital in NYC.  Surgeon and oncologist they see no benefit.   I want a masectomy and I dont know what to do if no one will do it.  I have researched the topic and I feel that getting rid of the tumor burden and radiation to the breast/chest followed by systemic therapy would give me a better chance. I should be able to have options and make decisions.  I want to go aggressive. Anyone know of a doctor who is treating his patients agressively Dx 5/2015, Right, Stage IV, ER+/PR+, HER2- (FISH) Log in to post a reply
